item.title: Sr. Consultant, Data and Analytics Enablement
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

The Sr. Consultant, Data and Analytics Enablement will help to enhance and manage the Client Experience environment, identify analytics needs & lead the design, development and delivery of data driven insights and solutions to fill the needs using Business Intelligence and ETL tools such as SAS, SQL, Oracle PL/SQL, Alteryx, and shell scripting.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Data Management – Create complex processes that sources, modifies and checks for data quality before loading to the destination tables. Ability to understand the process from front line application to end report and being able to design the best way to prepare and store the data for end user reporting.
  • Consultation Expertise – Develop reports and answer ad hoc request. Ability to answer and explain the data in the reports to business users. Find client improvement opportunities and build comprehensive data analysis. 
  • Relationships Building - Partner with end users, managers & directors to prioritize work and set goals on deliverables. Answer business data questions, investigate data quality/SLA issues and communicate resolution expectations. 
  • Data Analysis - Work with business partners to conduct business analyses. Be able to document and develop complex business requirements to deliver high quality solutions utilizing the existing infrastructure framework. Analyses will encompass end-to-end data management including data ingestion, transformation, calculation, and reporting of related metrics and results.
  • Focus on Innovation and Simplification - Strive for continual enhancement of data quality and contribute to system and governance process simplification.
  • Communication - Convey technical information understandable terms, both written and oral, to various stakeholders including business and technology partners.

Who You Are

  

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information. Understanding internal banking processes and how they translate into data outputs.
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results.
  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
  • You are passionate about new technologies. You keep up to date with the latest enterprise software and data management tools in industry. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You use your relationships and technical knowledge to influence enterprise projects.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work, and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability. You strive to lead with integrity; continuous improvement and talent development are an integral part of your personal brand. You bring people and networks together to Get Stuff Done.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-CC East 4th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Data Analyst, Advanced Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

You’ll be part of a dynamic team that provides advanced analytics services to assist Business Controls with effective risk management. You’ll lead the design, development, and implementation of actionable analytics solutions which help in strengthening the risk profiles across Personal and Small Business Banking. You’ll collaborate with partners from Business Controls, Risk Management, Product, and Frontline to identify and address emerging risk trends by leveraging data and analytics.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Innovative Problem Solving – Actively lead the development, delivery, and continuous improvement of complex data analytics and visualization solutions. Focus on quality, depth of analysis, and clear communication of actionable recommendations.
  • Collaboration – Continuous collaboration with internal and external partners is key to success. Be open-minded, adapt quickly, and constantly acquire new knowledge. Identify new business opportunities and seek to optimize current processes to promote data-driven decision-making.
  • Communication – Actively listen to understand a business problem and effectively articulate data analysis, interpretation, and assessment using language catered towards the audience.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience working with large datasets for advanced quantitative business and statistical analysis with technical experience in two or more of the following: SQL, Python, R, SAS, Tableau / BI Tools . You have strong data profiling, cleaning, mining and modelling skills.
  • You have completed a Bachelor\'s Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or related field or equal work experience preferred.
  • You are analytical. You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to simplify and communicate in an impactful way.
  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results.
  • You love to learn. You\'re a self-starter - passionate about growing your knowledge and challenging the status quo. You know that there is no limit to what you can achieve.
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-CC East 4th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Director, Strategic Initiatives Delivery
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

The Director, Strategic Initiatives Delivery is responsible for providing key management delivery support and oversight, leading initiation and analysis activities, program planning, and managing the delivery of complex data and analytics programs, bringing the project management focus to both business and technology deliverables. Responsibilities will vary depending on the Program assignment, ultimately bringing key stakeholders together to build consensus, define requirements, architect and deliver data and analytics solutions accelerating the user data maturity journey and speed to insight. The Delivery Director manages relationships with senior business partners, maintaining continuous business communications with them to proactively plan and deliver business value.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Project Management Office Expertise – Must have a minimum of 5 years of complex program or project delivery experience. Outline project goals, terms of reference, resource requirements, and costs. Help create a resource plan that ensures all stakeholders have a voice on the project. Must have knowledge of and experience with tools and techniques for initiating, planning, organizing, monitoring and controlling projects; ideally in both IT and Business delivery, and experience with business fiscal planning and road-map preparation.
  • Relationship Management & Collaboration - Responsible for the establishment and maintenance of stakeholder, client, and senior management relationships. Help internal partners make informed decisions about the development of programs, products, and services. Coach and mentor your teams as you work toward a common goal and negotiate deliverables and milestones whenever necessary.
  • Strong Leadership – Lead and coach a high performing team of individuals. Direct, motivate, and develop the team, maximizing their contributions and professional growth. Share knowledge and collaborate to come up with effective solutions to problems.
  • Business Analyses Experience – Must have experience working with business and technology stakeholders to define scope, process mapping and requirements, including communicating business needs and requirements to technology stakeholders and then communicating high level solutions and design back to the business.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in end-to-end project delivery and project management with proven ability to manage over $5MM programs including project management methodology, principles, and tools, within a minimum of 5 years’ experience as a Senior Project Manager, ideally within the financial services industry. You have sound knowledge of CIBC EDF (Enterprise Delivery Framework), managing application release activities and are proficient in the use of HP Planview and MS Project and other project management tools. The successful candidate will have a good understanding of financial aspects of project management (forecasting, estimating, tracking and reporting). You are an efficient communicator and you are able to influence without power.
  • You have experience managing demanding clients, multiple priorities, getting results in a matrixed environment where they may not have direct influence on project resources.
  • You have a degree/diploma in Computer Science, Engineering, and/or a related field of study. It’s an asset if you have your PMP Designation.
  • You are a bold and accountable leader. You have experience developing and implementing strategic team goals. You have experience coaching employees and driving successful team performance.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.
  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto 55 Yonge Street, 4th

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Director, Decision Science
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What you’ll be doing

You\'ll join our Strategy & Transformation team reporting to the Senior Director, Decision Science under Analytics & Decision Science. As a Director, Decision Science, you\'ll be responsible working with a team of analytical experts that will leverage the latest advanced analytical tools and our banks vast data to create differentiated analytical assets including various marketing models and next best recommendation system.

You’ll also be creating compelling presentations, which tell the analytic story, demonstrating their value by providing actionable insights with recommendations; will be acting as a primary client contact on all phases of the analytic project from problem definition through presentation, appropriately managing client expectations throughout the project.

How you’ll succeed

  • Lead and develop strong analytics and modeling team on a day-to-day basis, but also collaborating and participating hands-on in multiple projects to explore and capitalize on opportunities on marketing and campaign strategy, client acquisition, engagement and attrition, cross-sell and up-sell and next best recommendations
  • Structure, plan, and lead data science projects; and suggest project follow-on opportunities to increase value.
  • Manage multiple resources and projects concurrently to ensure successful completion of analytic projects and deliveries
  • Work with partners in marketing, operations, finance & digital to operationalize client journeys, generate hypotheses, review analysis results, and quantify business benefits to action and next best recommendation on our client needs sooner.
  • Develop and execute on a strategy on how to best leverage decision management tools and decision science capabilities in Personal and Business Banking

Who you are

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.
  • Experience with Advanced statistical and machine learning modeling and data science methods is mandatory
  • Post Graduate designation Master, PhD (preferred) in quantitative subjects such as Math, Statistics, Data Sciences, Computer Sciences
  • Experience in modern machine learning techniques for classification and regression as well as knowledge of A/B testing, experimental design, and various marketing modeling, experience with programming in SAS, R and Python
  • Have extensive experience solving analytical issues through quantitative approaches and machine learning methods as well as vast experience using advanced statistical methods, data mining techniques, and information retrieval
  • Well-developed leadership skills with proven ability to lead in a fast paced, ambiguous, multi-dimensional matrix environment and to effectively manage multiple activities with varying complexity while under tight time frames
  • Well-developed communication skills - Written and verbal skills to convey technical information in understandable terms as well as convey thoughts and ideas clearly and in a compelling influential manner

What CIBC offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Expected End Date

2021-06-25

Job Location

Toronto-33 Yonge Street, 7th

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Senior Manager, Unsecured Lending Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

Senior Manager, Unsecured Lending Analytics

We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What You’ll Be Doing

The Senior Manager, Unsecured Lending Analytics will be a leading contributor in the Analytics & Decision Science team supporting Personal and Business Banking. The Analytics & Decision Science team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment and Strategy. In this role, you will lead analytics engagements to evaluate client behaviours and optimize business decisions related to product, campaign, pricing and other business areas. You will present insights and make data-driven recommendations to senior leaders to help identify opportunities to grow the business and better serve our clients.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Consultant – be a leader in analytics consulting – Integrate deep domain knowledge with analytical capabilities to deliver value to stakeholders, enable data-driven decision making and proactively identify opportunities to drive business growth (projects/business cases, acquisition/retention campaigns, pricing, channels, segments, products and process enhancements
  • Analytics – Independently identify and leverage the right statistical techniques (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive) to extract actionable insights out of client behaviours and business trends (both internal and external).  Appropriately integrate of big data, business intelligence, visualization, self-service and analytical tools into engagements.  Proactively explore new applications of advanced analytics to innovate and build strategic analytics assets.
  • Technology – Leverage big data/analytical tools to analyze large structured and unstructured datasets, build data pipeline and visualization from multiple data sources.
  • Ownership – Orchestrate end-to-end delivery of solutions that meet stakeholder requirements and contribute to business success – you will think and act like an owner in analytics initiatives ensuring the proper identification and translation of business needs into analytics requirements.
  • Communication – Find the story in data and be flexible in communicating at varying levels of details for the right audience.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, business) or equivalent experience. Advanced degree is an asset (i.e. MMA, MBAN, MSc, MA, MBA).
  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.
  • You are proficient in programming languages and have experience using modern big data, analytical and dashboard tools (i.e. SAS, SQL, Python, R, Hadoop, Spark, Alteryx, Tableau, Cognos).
  • You have experience in building end-to-end analytics solutions involving large datasets (i.e. requirement gathering, data extraction, cleaning and transformation, statistical analysis, presentation & implementation).
  • You have working knowledge of statistical techniques (i.e. regression, time-series analysis, clustering, decision trees).
  • You are an avid learner who recognizes the analytics field is constantly evolving. You seek to explore emerging trends and best practices in the industry and are excited to share the knowledge with others.
  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work in Canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit
  • This is a regular full time role with a schedule of 37.5 hours each week.
  • Job location is 33 Yonge Street, 7th floor, however, this may change dependent on business need.

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Expected End Date

2021-08-02

Job Location

Toronto-33 Yonge Street, 7th

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

item.title: Consultant, Business Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What You’ll Be Doing

You’ll be part of a dynamic team that provides advanced analytics services to assist Business Controls with effective risk management. You’ll lead the design, development, and implementation of actionable analytics solutions which help in strengthening the risk profiles across Personal and Small Business Banking. You’ll collaborate with partners from Business Controls, Risk Management, Product, and Frontline to identify and address emerging risk trends by leveraging data and analytics.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Innovative Problem Solving – Actively lead the development, delivery, and continuous improvement of complex data analytics and visualization solutions. Focus on quality, depth of analysis, and clear communication of actionable recommendations.
  • Collaboration – Continuous collaboration with internal and external partners is key to success. Be open-minded, constantly acquire new knowledge, and share ideas to improve existing processes.
  • Communication – Actively listen to understand a business problem and effectively articulate data analysis and interpretation using language that resonates with your audience.
  • Consulting – Methodically break down complex business problems, deliver recommendations and grow solutions to create sustainable progress for our projects and programs.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in using analytical, data management, and visualization tools such as R, Python, SAS, SQL, Tableau, VBA. Knowledge of CIBC data sources/applications/ platforms is an asset. 3+ years of work experience in a fast paced analytics environment.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy wrangling large data sets and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You are a forward thinker. From building strategic solutions to writing good code/unit tests, you follow best practices with the intent of creating sustainable impact far into the future.
  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take the lead, curiosity drives you to go above and beyond, and you take pride in building trust with your partners through your work.
  • You have completed a Bachelor\'s Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or related field or equal work experience preferred.
  • You love to learn. You\'re passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you can achieve.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. Manager, Unsecured Lending Analytics

item.title: Consultant, Strategy
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

How You’ll Succeed

  • Strategic Problem Solving – Frame complex problem to be addressed, identify and execute required analysis with Analytics partners, and synthesize key findings to help the teams reach decisions
  • Analytics & Insights – Leverage internal CIBC data, external data and insights to develop a story and drive the need for change. Quantify impacts to the client and employee experience. Support pilots and bring meaning to data and results.  Build, develop and sustain data models & algorithms that support key strategic recommendations and decisions related to frontline distribution.  Lead work packages to enhance or implement new operating models, procedures and standards by researching/analyzing relevant data, and developing proposals and recommendations
  • Consulting – Foster collaborative relationships with internal stakeholders and peers. Provide value-added advisory support on strategic direction and best practices.  Participate and support in in-flight projects to ensure that the strategic vision and its benefits are realized.  Stay connected with the client journey and engage with our frontline partners regularly to understand the current strengths and challenges

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate knowledge of strategic planning principles sufficient to identify and develop initiatives. You have a strong understanding of Personal & Business Banking and enhanced technical knowledge in order to deal with more complex problems independently. You have superb analytical and financial acumen with developed knowledge in several areas of Financial Services sufficient to interpret, analyze and apply relevant issues and developments.
  • You are a problem solver.  You have creative problem solving skills sufficient to resolve or identify innovative alternatives or opportunities where established procedures for problems sometimes do not exist.
  • You deliver with urgency. You have the ability to manage multiple concurrent objectives, projects, groups or activities.  Effective judgment in prioritizing and time allocation
  • You have strong technical skills. You can demonstrate financial modeling skills in working with large datasets and ability to synthesize complex problems and solutions to “easy to understand” concepts.
  • Education. Background in Finance, Business, Computer Engineering/Science based discipline. Relevant graduate degree (MBA) or management consultant experience is an asset. 
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You have well-developed presentation skills, highly-developed writing skills, and influential skills sufficient to accomplish "significant" promotion & negotiation on CIBC’s behalf and to convince others of the value of preferred options or alternatives in situations where distinct differences of opinion or approach exist.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Expected End Date

2021-09-27

Job Location

81 Bay 25th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

item.title: Sr. Application Development Consultant (Cloud/App Modernization) CAM
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

You’ll be joining CIBC’s Asset Management (CAM) Technology group within Wealth Management and will be at the heart of CIBC’s technology transformation.  As Sr. Consultant, Application Development, you will support and contribute to the technology application delivery roadmap for CAM Technology. The incumbent will assist in shaping the strategic technology direction in accordance with the business agenda, determine technology optimization, appropriate risk management, and provide the development and maintenance capability for CAM technology systems, applications and processes to meet current and future business needs. This role supports a variety of technology disciplines and hands-on development work would be expected.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Strategic Development & Execution: Support CAM Technology needs as part of an integrated business and technology roadmap, align all technology application services to support those needs and deliver against them. Understand and implement our business strategies, operating model, and processing. Design, develop, implement/execute and support CAM Technology strategies which include:  Cloud strategy, Data and Business Analytics strategy, Application Modernization/CCR strategy, Application Health-check and Innovation strategy, Process Automation (QA), DevOps adoption. 
  • Relationship Management: Become a Subject Matter Expert for all CIBC enterprise development practices, standards and governance controls for other CIBC groups and technology vendors, as well as advise CAM Technology on emerging technical trends in the industry and at CIBC, and ensure application services best practices reflect appropriate technological developments for a competitive business position.  Collaborate and support the other CAM Technology teams in the delivery of technology modernization that address the strategic and operational CAM business partner agenda and the CIBC technology strategy.  Analyze technical risk to support business recommendations and make adjustments to internal operations as necessary to improve performance of the Application Delivery team and associated support teams. 
  • Subject Matter Expert: Apply knowledge of analytic applications, technologies, and concepts such as Data Warehouses, Data Marts, Business Intelligence, MIS, Hadoop, etc. as well as understanding and active practicing of Agile development methodology.  Utilize knowledge of the Software Development Lifecycle and application development along with exposure to Environment & Production Support. Develop solid understanding of CIBC methodologies and procedures while further expanding your knowledge of approaches, tools, and techniques for gaining the cooperation and support of others.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience with:  8+ yrs’ experience designing, developing, implementing and supporting applications with expertise in most of the following: Languages (Net, C#, C/C++, Foxpro, Python, Java, Javascript), Databases (Oracle, SQL Server, Sybase), Cloud (Azure, AWS), ETL (Informatica, SSIS), O/S (Sun Solaris, Microsoft Windows), Schedulers etc. (Feedhub, MFTS, Autosys) and Tools (Tools: source control/issue management: Git, TFS, JIRA, Azure DevOps).  This position requires working hands-on Technology experience to support the following CAM Technology strategies: Cloud, Data and Business Analytics, Application Modernization/CCR, Application Health-check and Innovation, Process Automation (QA) and DevOps adoption. You will utilize your breadth of knowledge to identify opportunities to optimize, modernize, retire or consolidate a large number of applications spanning numerous technologies.  It’s an asset if:  You have previous experience supporting a Wealth Management or Capital Markets client group or a passion to learn the CAM business.
  • You have a degree/diploma: Bachelors degree or equivalent in Computer Science or Technical discipline.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • You embrace and champion change: You’ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.  You empower and enable your team to make continuous improvement, go above and beyond, and deliver results.
  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of a team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, and individual development planning.
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto 55 Yonge Street, 11th

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5
